speaker: Matthew Barr
text: Keenan's first outing (no pun intended) sets the record straight (no pun intended) that Frasier's second season can hold up to the first. After some lacklustre episodes, this episode begins Keenan's tradition of farce that will continue to "The Two Mrs. Cranes" and "The Ski Lodge." Very well acted, with some great lines ("The Perils of Refinement," "If I could pick any man for Daphne, he's the one I'd pick," etc.), the only slow parts were the beginning which could have had more of an impact.  Still, watch this episode for a gay old time! **Grade: B+**

speaker: Michael Lee
text: This episode deserves special mention for two reasons: first, it marks the beginning of Joe Keenan's tenure with "Frasier," and a herald of some of the show's all-time funniest episodes.  Second, it was a landmark in and of itself, and won a special award from GLAAD (the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation), in recognition of the difficulty of introducing gay humor into a mainstream comedy show without conforming to stereotypes.  This is a challenge even for writers who are gay themselves, and Keenan succeeds brilliantly. The misunderstanding he sets up for the premise is perfectly credible, and Keenan hits several existing assumptions without relying on them to keep the plot going.  With this episode, "Frasier" (and Keenan) broke new ground and proved some important things, without which later shows like "Will & Grace" would not have been tried. **A-** [_This episode is virtually reproduced (but with Martin in the hot seat) in_ [[7.15]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_15/out_with_dad.html "Out With Dad") Out With Dad]   * * *  ## AWARDS & NOMINATIONS  ## Won  DIRECTORS GUILD OF AMERICA
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series
text: David Lee, Bill Carroll, Brian James Ellis, Katy Garretson, Rick Beren  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series
text: David Lee  ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY    *  **Reader's Favorites: 4TH**  GLAAD MEDIA AWARDS    *  **Outstanding Comedy Episode**  WRITERS GUILD OF AMERICA
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Comedy Series

speaker: Episodic Comedy (TV)
text: Joe Keenan  ## Nominated  EMMY
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Directing for a Comedy Series
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series
text: Joe Keenan  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Apartment -- Night It's late at night and everyone is fast asleep in the Crane household. Suddenly, the fire alarm goes off.  Martin and Frasier come running out in their sleepwear, panicking. _
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!  Fire!
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Writing for a Comedy Series

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie!  Eddie!  Where are you, boy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, wake up!  Dad, are you in there?

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie!  Here, Eddie!  Come on!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, where are you?  Where's the fire?

speaker: Martin
text: Have you seen Eddie?

speaker: Frasier
text: What's burning?  Where's the fire?

speaker: Martin
text: Eddie!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's alright, it's alright!  False alarm!  The one above my bed went off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank God!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, and don't worry about Eddie - he's back in my room. God, the noise the bloody thing makes!  It would be less upsetting just to wake up on fire!

speaker: Martin
text: What the hell triggered it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who knows?  I was dozing quite peacefully when it started screaming away for no reason at all. _Eddie runs in and jumps onto the chair with a packet of cigarettes in his mouth._

speaker: Frasier
text: I see. [_takes the packet_] What have we here?  Eddie, you've been smoking in Daphne's bedroom, bad dog!

speaker: Daphne
text: I know, you have a no-smoking rule.  I'm sorry.  But every now and again I feel a bit tense and I find a ciggy can be very soothing.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, it's real soothing.  It only should be an hour before my heart stops fibrillating. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading clock_] Oh, it figures, 3 AM.  Of course this would happen the night before I have an early morning meeting!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, aren't you going back to bed?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.  I'll just sit up for a bit, I'm feeling a bit blue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Anything you'd like to talk about?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, you need your sleep, it's nothing important. [_he starts to exit_] Just this feeling that my life's a gaping sinkhole and I'm just marking time while the flower of my youth rots on the vine.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_eager to escape_] Well, so long as you're sure. _He starts to exit again, but then Daphne sinks back, giving off a truly pathetic whine that is an obvious plea for help.  He has no choice but to come back._

speaker: Frasier
text: I really wish you'd tell me about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if you must know, it's my love life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  You've been seeing a man?

speaker: Daphne
text: Only when I close my eyes and concentrate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, I see.  You're going through a bit of a drought, eh?

speaker: Daphne
text: No wonder.  The rare times I do go out, it's usually with your father.  People see us and assume I'm his daughter, or else his girlfriend.  Either way, it's like having my own personal can of stud repellant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, I know how bleak these times can be.  But believe me, they will come to an end sooner or later.  I remember a time back in Boston when I was going through exactly what you're going through now.  Just a week later I met a lovely barmaid -- sophisticated, if a bit loquacious.  We fell madly in love, we got engaged... [_realizes_] Of course, she left me standing at the altar.  But the point is, I didn't give up. I took my poor, battered heart and offered it to Lilith... [_thinks, as Daphne lights a cigarette_] Who put it in her little Cuisinart and hit the puree button!  But, I rebounded! And look how far I've come... I'm divorced, lonely, and living with my father. _Frasier takes Daphne's cigarette and takes a drag.  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Cafe Nervosa The next day, Frasier is sitting at a table.  Roz comes in. _

speaker: Roz
text: I figured I'd find you here!  You know, you missed your meeting with the new station manager.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, I completely forgot.

speaker: Roz
text: God, you look like you've been ridden hard and put away wet.

speaker: Frasier
text: I was up till all hours of the night with Daphne, competing to see which one of us had the most pathetic love life.  On the bright side, I won.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I know what your problems are.  What are Daphne's?

speaker: Frasier
text: She's just having trouble finding men.

speaker: Roz
text: Say no more!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying to be tactful_] No, Roz, Roz, it's really not necessary.  You do not have to donate one of your boyfriends to Daphne.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, I'd be happy to.

speaker: Frasier
text: But still, one hates to break up a collection. _He tries to get her to close the book, as Niles returns to the table with coffees for himself and Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting down_] There we go - double espresso, and my mocha latte.  Do those chocolate shavings look any different to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they do to me.  I think they've switched to an inferior domestic brand. [_takes a sip and swishes them around like wine_] Mmm-hmm, mmm-hmm - waxy.

speaker: Roz
text: [_finding a name_] Oh, here we go!  Sven Bachman, he's an aerobics instructor.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, this one's perfect!  Gunther Dietrich.  He's loads of fun, and he's a runway model.

speaker: Frasier
text: A German narcissist; now there's an appealing combination.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, okay, I'll keep looking.

speaker: Niles
text: Looking for what?

speaker: Roz
text: I'm helping Frasier find a man for Daphne. _Niles puts down his cup and adopts a bland expression and tone that do nothing to hide his outrage._

speaker: Niles
text: [_lightly_] What?

speaker: Roz
text: Here we go!  He's a tennis instructor, and his name is Brick.

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, Frasier - Sven, Gunther, Brick?  Why not just lather Daphne up with baby oil and hurl her over the wall of a prison yard?

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me, but I've dated all these guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, where do you think I came up with the imagery?

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, you little titmouse-!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming between them_] Alright!  Niles: you are completely out of line here.  And Roz: he does have a point.  You and Daphne are entirely different kinds of women.  Whilst Daphne is very shy and inexperienced, you are more... well, a lot more... well, actually it's hard to find anyone who's more...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I get it!  Not one man I've ever dated is good enough for Miss Daphne, is that what you're trying to say?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's what I'm trying not to say, and you're not making it very easy.

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting up_] Oh, I'm out of here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, please wait.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh no, I can't stay, the fleet's in! _She storms out.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - KACL Frasier is doing his show, but waiting while a piercing tone sounds over the air.  Frasier resumes when it finishes._

speaker: Frasier
text: And this concludes our test of the emergency broadcast system. Had this been a real emergency, your radio would be melting in your hands.  We'll be right back after these messages. _He goes to commercial.  Roz stalks in and slams a half-eaten donut onto his console._

speaker: Roz
text: In the future, please keep your disgusting half-eaten food off my console.  In fact, just stay out of my sight!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're still mad at me, I can tell.

speaker: Roz
text: [_nasty_] And there's that keen sensitivity that keeps you in such demand with the ladies.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look Roz, I'm sorry if I insulted you earlier.  But the truth is, I feel very protective of Daphne.  See, the kind of man I'm looking for has to be good-looking, smart, successful... _Behind Frasier, Tom Duran, the new station manager, enters the booth. He instantly seems to embody all the virtues Frasier enumerated._

speaker: Tom
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?

speaker: Tom
text: I'm Tom Duran, the new station manager.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Tom, hey, it's a pleasure to meet you.  I'm so sorry about missing the meeting this morning, I slept right through it.

speaker: Tom
text: Oh yeah me too, and I was there.

speaker: Tom
text: Say, that's a beautiful tie.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you.  Yes, I got this one in London at one of those custom shops just of off Sloane Square.

speaker: Tom
text: You know, I just came from London.  I spent the last five years working for the BBC.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  I love London - the museums, the theatre...

speaker: Tom
text: Oh yeah, I'm a big theatre buff, three shows a week.  I hated leaving.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can imagine.  Why did you?

speaker: Tom
text: Well, I just kind of went through a messy break-up.  I thought I'd sleep better with a continent between us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I know the feeling! [_clicks_] So, I take it then you're unattached?

speaker: Tom
text: Yes, but I haven't given up hope.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you may have come to the right place.

speaker: Tom
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  You say you're very fond of the English?

speaker: Tom
text: Oh yes, very much.  You know, I think I've always had a weakness for people who are just a little eccentric.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_now really interested_] Really?

speaker: Roz
text: Fifteen seconds.

speaker: Tom
text: Well, it was nice meeting you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, say Tom, this may sound like short notice, but if you're not busy Saturday, why don't you come round my place for dinner?  Nothing fancy.

speaker: Tom
text: Well thanks, I'd like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Seattle, we're back.  Roz, who do we have up next?

speaker: Roz
text: We have James from Tacoma on line one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello James, I'm listening... _Tom walks down the hall and enters Roz's booth.  While Frasier is engaged with his caller Roz gets up and starts checking the carts on the wall.  They begin chatting about his fair Frasier._

speaker: Tom
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Tom.  How's it going?

speaker: Tom
text: Well, you know, it's the same with every job I take.  The word flies like wild fire.

speaker: Roz
text: What's that?

speaker: Tom
text: Oh, you know, you tell one or two people you're gay and before you can blink it's all over the station.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, they don't call it "broadcasting" for nothing.

speaker: Tom
text: He seems like a nice guy.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, he's OK.

speaker: Tom
text: I hope he's more than OK, he just asked me out on a date. _As Roz turns around in surprise, Frasier notices Roz talking to Tom and waves for her to stop._

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier just asked you out on a date?

speaker: Tom
text: Well, he asked me to his place for dinner.  So I wanted to ask you, is there any particular wine he likes?

speaker: Roz
text: Listen Tom, there is something I think you need to know about Frasier...

speaker: Tom
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: He's nuts about chardonnay.

speaker: Tom
text: Thanks! _He leaves.  Roz shrugs innocently at Frasier.  FADE TO:_ **THE PERILS OF REFINEMENT** _Scene Four -- Apartment Saturday evening, Frasier is setting up the apartment while a furious Daphne is setting the table. _

speaker: Daphne
text: Does he ask permission first?  Oh no, he just barges in and says he's set me up with God-knows-who, and I'm supposed to turn cartwheels like I'm bloody Cinderella.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you please relax?  Look, I told you, this is not a set- up.  Tom doesn't even know you'll be here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, an ambush then.  Much nicer!  My girlfriends in Manchester used to set me up all the time.  And it was always some gangly bounder with a boarding-house reach.  And he wasn't going for the Coleman's Hot Mustard, if you know what I mean!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just keep in mind, Tom is just a co-worker who's coming by for a pleasant little dinner.  If some sparks should ignite, then fine, but there is no pressure, absolutely no pressure... is that what you're wearing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Why, what's wrong with it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you have something with a little more oomph?  Oh, what About that, that strapless number you have? [_motions down his hips_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you have any idea how uncomfortable a strapless bra is?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thanks to my fraternity days, as a matter of fact I do! _He motions for Daphne to go and change, which she reluctantly does. He opens the door to Tom, dressed in a casual suit and carrying a bottle of wine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Tom!  Come on in.

speaker: Tom
text: Hi, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see you.

speaker: Tom
text: [_re: wine_] Oh, I don't know, something told me you might like chardonnay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my, that's my favorite.  So, what do you think of this place?

speaker: Tom
text: [_looking out the window_] That's a hell of a view!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's even better from the bedroom.

speaker: Tom
text: Why don't we just start with the drink?

speaker: Tom
text: [_re: dining table_] Oh, four places, who's joining us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just my little household: my father and his charming physical therapist, Daphne.

speaker: Tom
text: You live with your dad?  I can't even imagine that.  Well, I mean it's great that you get along so well, but doesn't, um... having him here put a crimp in your love life?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not at all.  Except when I bring my dates home, he tries to steal them.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's quite the old rascal!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, look who we have here.  Tom, I'd like you to meet Daphne.  Daphne this is Tom Duran.

speaker: Tom
text: [_shaking hands_] Pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Likewise.  Oh, Dr. Crane, you didn't take his coat!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: May I? _Tom turns around.  As Daphne takes his coat, she turns to Frasier, ecstatic, and mouths, "HE'S GORGEOUS!  THANK YOU, THANK YOU!"  Frasier mouths back, "YOU LOOK FABULOUS!  YOU LOOK FABULOUS!"  They stop as Tom turns round again.  She drapes the coat over her arm and starts to carry it to the rack, then stops._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, this is strange, I'm picking up a vibration from your coat.

speaker: Tom
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, Daphne feels she possesses psychic powers - you know those English eccentrics.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_comes back and takes Tom's hand_] Oh, you've just been through a very painful break-up, haven't you?

speaker: Tom
text: Yes! [_then, to Frasier_] Oh, wait a minute, you told her that, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.

speaker: Daphne
text: There was a bitter dispute about ownership of opera recordings.

speaker: Tom
text: [_drops onto the couch_] Whoa!

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll nip into the kitchen.  I have a bird to baste. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Quite something, isn't she?

speaker: Tom
text: Yeah, she's great.  I love hearing that accent again.

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] Hey Frasier, I don't have to put a tie on for this joker, do I? [_sees Tom_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Tom, this is my father, Martin Crane.

speaker: Tom
text: Tom Duran, nice to meet you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking hands_] I'm sorry about that "joker" business. [_Tom waves it off_] I call everybody joker, jerk, pinhead, bozo...

speaker: Frasier
text: And amazingly he's free for dinner on short notice. Why don't I just open some of this wonderful wine?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's a looker.  I'm glad you made me put on my lucky bra. He's worth every wire digging into my ribcage.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you've made quite an impression on him too.  He thinks you're great!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, go on! [_giggles_] God, listen to me getting carried away like a school girl when I've just met the man.  No, I'm not raising my hopes tonight - though I'm glad I raised my bosom.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, let me tell you, you're gonna love Seattle.  It's a real people place.  Great food, great bars...

speaker: Tom
text: I've heard that.  Any you recommend?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I usually hang out at a place called Duke's.  Great crowd, lot of young cops. [_Tom is pleased_] So, do you like football?

speaker: Tom
text: Yeah, yeah, I really missed it when I was living in London.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well maybe we can take you to see a Seahawks game sometime.  Frasier hates it, so it'd just be us.

speaker: Tom
text: Hey, Frasier warned me about you!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I guess I yell at the players too loud. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_entering_] Here we are, Tom. [_hands him wine_] Dad, I took the liberty of selecting an amusing little vintage for you too. [_hands him a Ballantine_] Sorry, I didn't bring the pull-tab so you could sniff it.

speaker: Martin
text: Merci beaucoup. [_pronounces it "mercy bow-coop."_] _The doorbell sounds so Frasier goes to answer it.  Niles is standing there with a book._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier. [_takes Frasier's wine glass_] Oh, thank you. I just stopped by to return your book. [_hands it over_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, thank you, well don't let me keep you.

speaker: Niles
text: Am I interrupting something?

speaker: Frasier
text: As a matter of fact, I'm introducing a man to Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah!  Guess you don't want me around then. [_walks in_] How do you do?  I'm Dr. Niles Crane.

speaker: Tom
text: Hi, I'm Tom Duran.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_peeks out_] Bird's all done.  Now all I need is a pair of big strong arms to haul it out of the oven.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I certainly don't need to be asked twice. _He quickly walks into the kitchen, to Daphne's disappointment and Frasier's anger.  END OF ACT ONE (Time: 14:10)  ACT TWO  Scene Five - Apartment During dinner, Tom is telling a story about the queen in the middle of an interview._

speaker: Tom
text: So, halfway through the interview her stomach starts rumbling. And her body mike's picking it up, but I have to ignore it. Because what am I going to say; "Would her majesty care for a Tums?"

speaker: Daphne
text: I could listen to your stories all night.  They're so funny.

speaker: Niles
text: And all involving bodily functions.

speaker: Daphne
text: Tom, I could use a little hand in the kitchen...

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, sit Daphne, after all that cooking you must be... [_looks down her frock_] absolutely strapless. _Niles exits to the kitchen, leaving Daphne disappointed again.  In the kitchen, Niles puts a few things into the sink.  Tom enters, slightly piqued._

speaker: Tom
text: Er, Niles, can I speak with you for a moment?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes. [_slaps down silverware_]

speaker: Tom
text: I was wondering, did I do anything that offended you?

speaker: Niles
text: No. [_angrily throws pots into the sink_]

speaker: Tom
text: Oh.  It must be all in my head, but I sensed that you had a problem with me dating Frasier.

speaker: Niles
text: [_turns round_] Well, if you must know...

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, what was the question?

speaker: Tom
text: [_crosses his arms_] Do you have some problem with me dating your brother?

speaker: Niles
text: [_graciously_] No.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_entering_] Now Niles, I didn't ask Tom to dinner so he could talk with you all night in the kitchen.  There are others who would like to have a crack at him! _Frasier and Tom exit.  Niles just stands there with a small smile that threatens to explode into hysterics.  Rocking slightly, he twirls once on his heel, as Martin enters with some plates._

speaker: Martin
text: That Tom's a great guy, huh?  You think maybe him and Daphne... _Niles shakes his head, combining laughter with a negative "Mmm-mmm."  On the balcony, Tom, Frasier and Daphne are having a little chat._

speaker: Tom
text: You know, I can't remember the last time I had such a wonderful evening.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh no, we should be thanking you.  I can't remember when I've laughed so hard. _From inside the apartment they suddenly hear Martin roaring with laughter.  They look and see him doubled over in the kitchen, while Niles laughs along._

speaker: Daphne
text: You've still got Mr. Crane going.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, I think a little after dinner music would be appropriate.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good idea. [_she goes to the stereo_]

speaker: Frasier
text: She's, er, quite a woman, isn't she?

speaker: Tom
text: [_flatly:_] Yes, she's really something, [_suggestive:_] Um, Frasier, I was wondering.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes?

speaker: Tom
text: Do you think before the evening's over we could get a little one-on-one time?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think I can arrange that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: He says he wants to be alone with you!

speaker: Daphne
text: No!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Daphne
text: This really is my lucky bra!  Keep the wine flowing, I'll go fix my lipstick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I guess I'd better be hitting the old sack.  Don't want to stand in the way of young romance! [_hides a grin_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Goodnight, Tom.

speaker: Tom
text: Goodnight, Martin.

speaker: Frasier
text: And Niles, isn't it time you were running along too?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I must be on my way.  And, Frasier, I must apologise, I was wrong about Tom.  If I had to choose a man for Daphne, he's the one I'd pick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good.

speaker: Niles
text: Goodnight Tom, nice to meet you.

speaker: Tom
text: Goodnight.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, a word in your ear? _Surprised, Frasier motions "one second" to Tom, and follows Niles out the front door into the corridor._

speaker: Niles
text: There's something I have to tell you.  Dad wanted to but I won the coin toss.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, what is it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I had a little chat with Tom in the kitchen and he told me he's interested in pursing a romantic relationship. But, the object of his affections is not Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn that Roz!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  It's you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?  That's impossible, Tom's not gay!

speaker: Niles
text: He seems to be under that impression.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what on earth could have made him think I was interested in him?  All I did was ask him if he was attached, and then we talked about the theatre and men's fashions... [_clicks_] Oh my God!  Niles, do you realise what this means?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, you're dating your boss.  You of all people should know the pitfalls of an office relationship.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but he... he just never mentioned the fact he...

speaker: Niles
text: [_in elevator:_] I'll call you tomorrow.  But not too early, of course. [_the doors close on Niles's laugh_] _Frasier, sweating like a pig and as red as a beetroot enters the room. The romantic music that Daphne put on is playing.  Tom is lounging on the couch, massaging his neck.  His glasses are off, and he casts a sly look at Frasier that leaves no room for doubt._

speaker: Tom
text: So...

speaker: Frasier
text: So... God, I hate this song.

speaker: Tom
text: You know, I've broken my rule for you.  I usually don't date guys I work with.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I've sort of relaxed my rule for you too.

speaker: Tom
text: You're cute when you're nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must be downright adorable now then.  Listen Tom, I'm sorry, but we seem to have gotten our lines crossed here. The truth is I'm entirely straight.

speaker: Tom
text: [_puts on his glasses_] Hey, if you're not interested just say so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, it's true, I really am.  I just invited you to dinner because you seemed so charming and you were so fond of the British, I thought you might be the perfect man for Daphne.

speaker: Tom
text: I can't believe this.  You really had no idea that I'm gay? _Daphne stops, unclasps her not-so-lucky bra and walks back to her bedroom, chucking the bra up in the air as she goes. The two men stand in embarrassed silence for a moment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't take this wrong, but it never even occurred to me you might be gay.

speaker: Tom
text: Well, it never even occurred to me that you might be straight.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_uncertain_] Thank you.  Geez, Tom, I feel just awful. Seems I've just been leading you on all night.

speaker: Tom
text: [_getting his coat_] Oh, it's OK.  It's an honest mistake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but I've been pouring you drinks, building up your hopes, making you think you might have found a man sophisticated and sensitive enough to help you...

speaker: Tom
text: [_amused_] Frasier, I'll learn to love again.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] Yes, of course.

speaker: Tom
text: You'll apologize to Daphne?

speaker: Frasier
text: For the rest of my days.

speaker: Tom
text: [_starts to leave, then_] Does this mean your dad's not gay either?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, dad's not gay.

speaker: Tom
text: [_starts to leave again, then_] But Niles - come on! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smiles_] No, I'm afraid not.

speaker: Tom
text: Huh... so wait a minute, this Maris guy he kept mentioning is a woman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the jury's still out on that one. _Tom grimaces and leaves, waving goodnight.  END OF ACT TWO (Time: 21:16)_
